strings:
<se_low>Yangus: Wot we doin' back at the Dragon Graveyard?
Our job's done 'ere now, innit?
Or is there somewhere you forgot to explore?

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, right. We'd better 'ave a proper look around this time, then.
Don't wanna 'ave to come back again, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: You wot!? Then why 'ave we come back 'ere!?

<se_low>Yangus: You weren't missin' it, were ya!?
I never knew this kinda place was your cup o' tea!

<se_high>Jessica: Just look at all of the dragon bones around here.
This place certainly lives up to its name.
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe dragons have some sense of when their lives are going to end, and come in here to die with some dignity.
<se_def>Angelo: Do you remember seeing that ancestor of the Golding family when we were last here in the Dragon Graveyard?
<se_def>Angelo: I can't remember a word he said, but the sight of him speaking from beyond the grave really stuck in my mind...
<se_low>Yangus: We'd better get a move on an' make up for all the time we lost!
<se_high>Jessica: I'm glad Cash was waiting where he said he'd be.
<se_high>Jessica: It wouldn't be much use working as bodyguards if we didn't have a body to guard.

<se_def>Angelo: I wonder how far ahead Carrie is.
I hope we can still catch up with her...
<se_low>Yangus: We won't be seein' no daylight again 'til we've managed to catch up wiv Carrie, eh?

<se_high>Jessica: I think we're still okay.
If we hurry, I'm sure we can catch up with Carrie.
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather rude to abandon someone who's counting on our help, you know. We should probably be more careful about that from now on.
<se_low>Yangus: We'd better get a move on an' make up for all the time we lost!
<se_high>Jessica: I'm glad Carrie was waiting where she said she'd be.
<se_high>Jessica: It wouldn't be much use working as bodyguards if we didn't have a body to guard.

<se_def>Angelo: I wonder how far ahead Cash is.
I hope we can still catch up with him...
<se_low>Yangus: We won't be seein' no daylight again 'til we've managed to catch up wiv Cash, eh?

<se_high>Jessica: I think we're still okay.
If we hurry, I'm sure we can catch up with Cash.
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather rude to abandon someone who's counting on our help, you know. We should probably be more careful about that from now on.
<se_low>Yangus: Judgin' by the name o' the place, this is prob'ly somewhere they used to bury dragons, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Oooh! Gives me the willies just thinkin' about it!
<se_high>Jessica: Does anyone really believe that the loser of this little contest is going to gracefully concede their interest in the casino?
<se_high>Jessica: It isn't hard to imagine one of them raising a stink after it's all said and done... Making all of this a colossal waste of time.

<se_def>Angelo: Cash and Carrie may argue all the time, but it's not all bad.
It's just another way of communicating, really.

<se_def>Cash: So you're saying our fighting is a good thing!?
Huh! You're obviously an only child!

<se_def>Angelo: ...Actually, I do have an older brother, but we don't really speak.
He seems to wish I didn't exist.

<se_def>Cash: Well, he may be a pain in the butt, but he's still your brother.
You should just feel lucky to have him.

<se_def>Angelo: Oh, come off it!
If you feel like that, then why are you two always arguing!?
<se_def>Angelo: If Carrie's already reached the end, then we're flogging a dead horse here.
<se_def>Angelo: If only we'd started at the same time, I'm sure we'd have won.
<se_def>Angelo: Not that we've lost yet, of course.
<se_low>Yangus: Once this is all done wiv, an' the new owner's decided, will the casino open up again, like?
<se_def>Cash: Well, duh! That's the idea! I wanna get that place up and running again A.S.A.P., so that's another reason to get this trial out of the way.
<se_def>Angelo: I can't imagine it would've been that difficult to keep the casino open even without an official decision on the new owner.

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah! Good point!
Ev'ryone knows Goldin's snuffed it now, so wot's the point in keepin' the place closed?
<se_def>Cash: You don't get it. The casino has to have an owner. We can't open it up until that's decided. That's just the way it is.
<se_low>Yangus: Cor, you're a stubborn one, ain't ya...

<se_low>Yangus: There are dragon bones all over the place in 'ere, eh?
An' they're big'uns, an' all.
<se_low>Yangus: If one o' them was to come back to life, we'd really 'ave our 'ands full!
<se_high>Jessica: What exactly is Cash planning to do once he catches up with Carrie?
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe he's going to tell her that's when the race really begins, and they'll sprint for the finish line.
<se_def>Angelo: My brother can't stand to be reminded of my existence and ignores me whenever possible.

<se_def>Angelo: So I think Cash is quite a nice brother, really, taking part in this challenge with Carrie.
At least he acknowledges her.
<se_low>Yangus: Waaah, guv!
<se_low>Yangus: If we don't sock it to them two monsters, Cash an' Carrie'll be 'istory!
<se_high>Jessica: If we don't get some help for Cash and Carrie, neither one is going to make it out of there alive!

<se_def>Angelo: How brave of him to risk his life to save her like that.
That's just how a brother should be.

<se_def>Angelo: We can't let a gesture like that count for nothing.
We have to hurry up and defeat those monsters!
<se_low>Yangus: Who'd 'ave thought it'd come to this, eh!?

<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if they'll declare this trial null and void, and come back and do it all again...
Just thinking about it is exhausting!

<se_high>Jessica: Angelo! Stop thinking about NEXT time!
THIS time isn't over yet!
We need you here and now!

<se_high>Jessica: Cash and Carrie are out cold!
If we don't save their lives, there won't be a next time to think about!
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose we'd better not leave Cash an' Carrie in such a state, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Let's go an' 'elp 'em out!
<se_high>Jessica: The way Cash tried to protect Carrie reminded me of Alistair.

<se_high>Jessica: But this isn't the time for reminiscing.
We've got to help those two!

<se_def>Angelo: Cash risked his life to save Carrie.
What a waste to just leave him to die!

<se_def>Angelo: Not that we know he's dead yet, of course.
If we hurry, we might be able to save both of them.

<se_low>Yangus: Ya can tell Cash an' Carrie are brother and sister, eh?
They're like peas in a pod, them two.
<se_low>Yangus: Ruddy stubborn peas in a stubborn bloomin' pod, they are!
<se_high>Jessica: I'm really glad we decided to accept this bodyguard assignment.
<se_high>Jessica: I feel like we gave those two the chance they needed to finally put aside their differences.

<se_def>Angelo: Carrie may always be hurling insults at him, but she still obviously cares for Cash a lot.
He is her brother, after all.

<se_low>Yangus: Heh heh heh! Feelin' a bit jealous, are ya!?
That could be you an' Marcello, y'know!
<se_def>Angelo: You get some funny ideas sometimes...
<se_def>Angelo: Well, they patched things up a lot more easily than I'd have expected. It's good that they could both back down like that.

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah, but they'll prob'ly be just as quick to start arguin' again, I reckon.
Somefin's bound to set that pair off before long.
<se_def>Angelo: In that case, we'd better get this over with and escort them both home while they're still on speaking terms.

<se_high>Jessica: Just listen to you two! You're terrible!
There's no need to be so cynical about it.
They made up. We should be happy for them.
<se_def>Angelo: We should go after them and make sure we stick with them to the end.

<se_def>Angelo: We're supposed to be their bodyguards, after all.
It's our job to see them safely back to Baccarat.
<se_low>Yangus: Judgin' by the name o' the place, this is prob'ly somewhere they used to bury dragons, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Oooh! Gives me the willies just thinkin' about it!
<se_high>Jessica: Does anyone really believe that the loser of this little contest is going to gracefully concede their interest in the casino?
<se_high>Jessica: It isn't hard to imagine one of them raising a stink after it's all said and done... Making all of this a colossal waste of time.

<se_def>Angelo: Cash and Carrie may argue all the time, but it's not all bad.
It's just another way of communicating, really.

<se_high>Carrie: What!? Like, where's the communicating in a brother-sister fight!?
Let me guess, you're an only child.

<se_def>Angelo: ...Actually, I do have an older brother, but we don't really speak.
He seems to wish I didn't exist.
<se_high>Carrie: Well, he may be a pain in the butt, but he's still, like, your brother! You should just feel lucky to have him. Got it!?

<se_def>Angelo: Oh, come off it!
If you feel like that, then why are you two always arguing!?
<se_def>Angelo: If Cash's already reached the end, then we're flogging a dead horse here.
<se_def>Angelo: If only we'd started at the same time, I'm sure we'd have won.
<se_def>Angelo: Not that we've lost yet, of course.

<se_low>Yangus: There are dragon bones all over the place in 'ere, eh?
An' they're big'uns, an' all.
<se_low>Yangus: If one o' them was to come back to life, we'd really 'ave our 'ands full!

<se_high>Jessica: Look, I don't care who wins this competition.
When it's over, you need to make up with your brother.
<se_high>Carrie: Maybe I'll think about it if he kneels down in front of me and apologises properly.
<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe you're still talking like that! You're terrible!

<se_high>Jessica: You two are lucky to have one another.
He's your only brother, after all!

<se_high>Carrie: Where do you get off, dishing out advice like that?
You're supposed to be my bodyguard, not my mother!

<se_high>Carrie: This is between me and Cash!
So just butt out! Okay?
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder what Carrie will do if she catches up with Cash?
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe she's going to tell him that's when the race really begins, and they'll sprint for the finish line.
<se_def>Angelo: I can understand Carrie feeling so irritated with her brother.
<se_def>Angelo: But it's wonderful that he sits up and takes notice. Even when she's insulting him, he doesn't ignore her.
<se_def>Angelo: As brothers go, Cash is a hundred times better than Marcello.
<se_low>Yangus: Waaah, guv!
<se_low>Yangus: If we don't sock it to them two monsters, Cash an' Carrie'll be 'istory!
<se_high>Jessica: If we don't get some help for Cash and Carrie, neither one is going to make it out of there alive!
<se_def>Angelo: Carrie must really care about Cash to risk her life to save him like that.

<se_def>Angelo: It's not too late for them.
They can still patch things up.
<se_low>Yangus: Who'd 'ave thought it'd come to this, eh!?

<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if they'll declare this trial null and void, and come back and do it all again...
Just thinking about it is exhausting!

<se_high>Jessica: Angelo! Stop thinking about NEXT time!
THIS time isn't over yet!
We need you here and now!

<se_high>Jessica: Cash and Carrie are out cold!
If we don't save their lives, there won't be a next time to think about!
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose we'd better not leave Cash an' Carrie in such a state, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Let's go an' 'elp 'em out!

<se_high>Jessica: Carrie risked her life to save Cash.
That tells you how important he is to her.

<se_high>Jessica: But there's no time to stand around and chat about it now.
We'd better go and help them!

<se_def>Angelo: Carrie risked her life to save Cash.
What a waste to just leave her to die!

<se_def>Angelo: Not that we know she's dead yet, of course.
If we hurry, we might be able to save both of them.
<se_low>Yangus: Can you believe 'ow she give 'im a wallop like that!? An' THEN said she'd make up!? They're like a couple o' Pickham roughies, them two.
<se_high>Jessica: That's pretty generous of Cash, forgiving Carrie for smacking him in the face!

<se_def>Angelo: Did you see the punch Carrie had on her!?
That was pretty impressive!

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah, but d'ya reckon they can really make up after somefin' like that?
I'd 'ave thought it'd make things worse, meself.

<se_def>Angelo: I don't know.
Maybe it got rid of all of Carrie's pent-up frustrations.
<se_def>Angelo: We should go after them and make sure we stick with them to the end.

<se_def>Angelo: We're supposed to be their bodyguards, after all.
It's our job to see them safely back to Baccarat.

<se_low>Yangus: I can't stop thinkin' about that crystal, y'know.
I'm almost tempted to 'ave away wiv it!
<se_low>Yangus: There'd be plenty o' people out there who'd give me a stonkin' price for that baby!

<se_high>Jessica: I bet you anything that this ancestor of theirs is going to make some preachy sermon.
You mark my words.
<se_high>Jessica: The big question is, how are they going to listen to someone who's been dead for generations?
<se_def>Angelo: Why are Cash and Carrie just standing around like that?

<se_def>Angelo: They should get a move on and speak to this ancestor of theirs.
Then we'll be able to get out of here at last.
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder wot's waitin' for 'em behind those doors, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Why don't we go an' 'ave a look an' all, now that we're 'ere?

<se_high>Jessica: They didn't have to open the door with their bare hands, did they?
There must have been some other way!
<se_high>Jessica: Then again, if the burns really are the proof of being the head of the family, I suppose they didn't have a choice.

<se_high>Jessica: Looks like you've got to suffer in order to become the owner of the casino.
No pain, no gain, as they say...
<se_def>Angelo: Now they have to ‘listen to the words of their ancestor’, right?
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose that just means they have to read some old inscription on a monument or something.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot d'ya reckon a dragon would make o' this place then, eh? Prob'ly find it pretty creepy, I'll bet. Be shakin' at the knees, worryin' about dragon ghosts an' all that.
<se_low>Yangus: I mean, if I'm ever in a place full of 'uman bones, me knees go ten to the dozen. ...Wot? Well, it is creepy, innit?
<se_low>Yangus: I thought it was only Rhapthorne we 'ad to worry about, not no one else. But there's more troublemakers wantin' a piece o' me, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Right, let's get over to the wasteland and see wot's so special about this Jug-o'-wotsit, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: Bones, bones and more bones...
That's all there is in 'ere. Uuurgh!
Reminds me too much of a graveyard.
<se_low>Yangus: Don't go tellin' no one, but I ain't that good when it comes to graveyards an' ghosts an' the like.
<se_high>Jessica: What I saw in that weird daydream <endash> or whatever it was <endash> was a crystal ball right inside the cave. That's where we should be looking, I think.
<se_high>Jessica: The wild lands is where we found the old ship before. Come on, there's no time to lose!

<se_high>Jessica: Just look at all of the dragon bones around here.
This place certainly lives up to its name.
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe dragons have some sense of when their lives are going to end, and come in here to die with some dignity.
<se_def>Angelo: Well, talk about an anticlimax. There's nothing here. Still, I suppose we should be grateful that Jessica's premonition was all just hot air.
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if the fact that only she saw it is because of the influence Rhapthorne had over her before? In which case, there's someone else who may have...
<se_def>Angelo: Sorry, forget I said anything. Just mumbling to myself.
<se_def>Angelo: Hang on! The Lord of Darkness has been resurrected! Do you really think this is the time for a potholing expedition!?

<se_def>Angelo: I realise you feel at home in caves, so we'll come back some other time.
But let's defeat Rhapthorne first, all right!?
<se_def>Angelo: If he destroys the world, there won't be any caves left for you to explore!
<se_high>Red: I tell ya wot, 'ow about instead of sittin' 'ere natterin', we focus on catchin' up wiv Carrie, eh?
<se_low>Morrie: This is what I am afraid of. The signorina Carrie is not here at the entrata.
<se_low>Morrie: As the guardie of signor Cash, we cannot be losing to the signorina, ay? We have our HONOUR to protect! Our PASSION to preserve!
<se_low>Morrie: We are the bodyguards! The MUSCOLO! We do not leave our mark for nothing!
<se_high>Red: I tell ya wot, 'ow about instead of sittin' 'ere natterin', we focus on catchin' up wiv Cash, eh?
<se_low>Morrie: This is what I am afraid of. The signor Cash is not here at the entrata.
<se_low>Morrie: As the guardie of signorina Carrie, we cannot be losing to the signor, ay? We have our HONOUR to protect! Our PASSION to preserve!
<se_high>Red: I can't say I really give a monkey's about who the next owner o' the casino is.
<se_high>Red: Wot I can't figure out is, 'ow come they're doin' a trial like this anyway, eh? I mean, they're not in'eritin' a flamin' weapons shop, are they? It's just a gamblin' gaff, right?
<se_low>Morrie: The signorina Carrie, she is not here. We are too tardy, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: But still we must not throw away our towels! We must hurry even more for our cliente, the signor Cash.

<se_high>Red: Blimey, the bond o' family, eh?
Brings a tear to the eye, dunnit?
<se_high>Red: Not that I'd know much about all that.
<se_low>Morrie: Si, signor Cash! Now I see your GUSTO! I feel your PASSION! You risk your life for your sister like a true MAN, ay!
<se_high>Red: Well, we done a fine job o' bein' bodyguards, eh?
<se_high>Red: Maybe if we finish off them monsters now, we can call it quits, though.
<se_low>Morrie: The signor and signorina are in danger! We cannot stand here chat-chitting like the idioti, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Si, signorina Carrie! Now I see your GUSTO! I feel your PASSION! You risk your life for your brother like a true eroina, ay!
<se_high>Red: Blimey, I've seen it all now! But I s'pose we better stick wiv 'em 'til they're back 'ome, eh?
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha! MAGNIFICO! Now they are seeing eyes to eyes, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: The signor Cash, he is not here. We are too tardy, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: But still we must not throw away our towels! We must hurry even more for our cliente, the signorina Carrie.
<se_high>Red: That's a pretty nice lump o' stone, that is. Must be worth a bob or two. I wouldn't mind addin' that to me collection.
<se_low>Morrie: What are the words of wisdom this ancestor will have? Maybe some casino trade secrets, ay?
<se_high>Red: So wot's behind them doors, d'ya think?
<se_high>Red: Treasure? I mean, we're talkin' about a former casino owner. Anyone in that game's gotta 'ave a pretty penny stashed away, right?
<se_low>Morrie: Ahia! When I see the burns, I feel in the pain like it's mine, you know?
<se_high>Red: A crystal ball 'idden in some graveyard, eh? Sounds like the sort of thing that could fetch a nice price wiv the right buyer. ...Awright, I'm in!
<se_high>Red: Well, 'e does call 'imself the Lord o' Darkness, don't 'e? Wiv an 'ighfalutin name like that, 'e's bound to 'ave some pretty tough 'enchmen, eh?
<se_high>Red: Anyway, it don't look like there's anyfin' more of value round 'ere. If we're done wiv this place, let's get movin'.
<se_low>Morrie: I was sure, once we are in the place in the flesh, I would feel what is coming on the wind. Ma no! I got nothing! Niente!
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe only the ones who have been cursed by the Rhapthorne have these strange premonizioni, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Tsk, like they are the chosen ones! The special ones! The BEST ones! I WANNA BE CHOSEN TOO!
<se_low>Morrie: Imagine it! If we could persuade such a gigante dragon to come into my monstrous pit! The spettatori, they go wild, ay!
<se_low>Morrie: Hmmm, but maybe it's not so easy to find a dragon that is still alive and kicking about, ay?
<se_high>Red: There's nuffin' much in the way o' treasure round these parts. That's wot me intuition's tellin' me.

<se_low>Morrie: If we cannot keep in focus, our young ragazzo's story is gonna dry up like the prune, ay?
Allora! To the next avventura!
